sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Ukraine was always going to dominate talks between Presidents Joe Biden and Vladimir Putin, and it was certainly top of the list. But the two leaders who met via video link made little apparent progress in diffusing the crisis in the wake of a Russian troop build-up along Ukraine's border. Instead, they delegated officials from both countries to stay in contact.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: On Biden's part, his spokesperson said he had warned Putin that sanctions would follow in the event of an escalation of the situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: President Biden was direct and straightforward with President Putin, as he always is.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: He reiterated America's support for Ukraine's sovereignty and territorial integrity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: He told President Putin directly that if Russia further invades Ukraine, the United States and our European allies would respond with strong economic measures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In a statement from the Kremlin, it said Vladimir Putin had stressed that the responsibility should not be shifted onto the shoulders of Russia, since it was NATO making dangerous attempts to conquer Ukrainian territory and is building up its military potential at Russian borders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It added that Russia is seriously interested in obtaining reliable, legally fixed guarantees that rule out NATO expansion eastward.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ukraine has good reason to feel threatened.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: More than 90,000 Russian troops are believed to be near its borders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A large part of the recent Russian military build-up is in Crimea, which Russia seized from Ukraine and then annexed in 2014.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: There is divided opinion on the Russian

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: leader here in the United States. In one camp he's viewed as sort of a giant, a nervy poker player who rarely sets a foot wrong, while others, and this is an increasing number of observers, diplomats, and Russia experts are advising American policymakers that it's actually Vladimir Putin who's playing the weak hand here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He has very few tools at his disposal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: The Nord Stream 2 pipeline is still not complete and with a new administration coming in in Germany may be vulnerable to the kinds of sanctions that would reduce the number of euros the number of dollars the number of pounds sterling flowing into russian coffers just as winter is starting to really bite across northern europe so it's unclear where we go from here it's clear what the two leaders want can either afford to let the other side get what it wants that's what remains to be seen well many experts think that vladimir putin has not made up his mind yet but he surely wants to

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: show that russia is uh would not be afraid of any sanctions and would do what it needs to be done if it decides to.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: I have spoken with Andrey Kartunov.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: He is the head of Russia International Affairs Council, which is very close to the Kremlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Well, he says that what is happening is not any preparation for any military intervention.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: He said that if Vladimir Putin wanted this, no one would even notice such preparations and would only understand when Russian soldiers would be already on the territory of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: So Andriy Kartunov told me that what is happening on the border, this mass troops gathering is just a message, a warning to Ukraine and the US, a warning of Russia who says don't cross my red lines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The UK government has said no Christmas party took place in December last year

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: after an ITV video emerged showing Downing Street staff joking over one during a rehearsal for a news conference.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Prime Minister's then-Press Secretary, Allegra Stratton, is heard saying this fictional party was a business meeting and it was not socially distanced. At the time, the government stated people should not have Christmas gatherings. Australia's Prime Minister, Scott Morrison, has joined the US in a diplomatic boycott of the Beijing Winter Olympics over human rights concerns.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Morrison said it should come as no surprise that officials would boycott the event after the nation's relationship with China had broken down in recent years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He said Australian athletes would still be able to compete.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: More than three years after the murder of Saudi regime critic Jamal Khashoggi, a suspect has been arrested in Paris. The 33-year-old was picked up by border police at Charles de Gaulle airport. He's reportedly named on an Interpol list.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: He is reportedly named on an Interpol list. However, a Saudi official claims the arrest is a case of mistaken identity and that those involved in the murder have been convicted in Saudi Arabia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Khashoggi was killed by a special squad in the Saudi consulate in Istanbul in October 2018.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The detention of the suspect comes three days after French President Emmanuel Macron visited Saudi Arabia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: According to US intelligence, Khashoggi's murder was authorized by Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: After international pressure, the government in Riyadh admitted killing the journalist, but denied that the heir to the throne had known about it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Thousands of emails from Afghans pleading for Britain's help went unread in an evacuation

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: that was both arbitrary and dysfunctional.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: That's according to a whistleblower in his written statement to a parliamentary committee.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Raphael Marshall was working at the British Foreign Office at the time of the fall of Kabul to the Taliban.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Part of his evidence said that between 75,000 and 150,000 people applied for evacuation, most feared for their lives, at risk because of their connection to the UK and the West. He said he estimated that fewer than 5% received any assistance. Marshall went on to list failings in the system, including an arbitrary and dysfunctional prioritisation process, inadequate staffing, including lack of night shifts, lack of expertise and arbitrary allocation of staff and lack of urgency. Former Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab, who was moved from the Foreign Office to become Justice Secretary after the crisis, has been forced to defend his actions. What is certainly true is that we had a lot of people rushing to get out of Afghanistan for all sorts of reasons. And I think it's right that we had a lot of people rushing to get out of Afghanistan for all sorts of reasons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: And I think it's right that we had a process in place to check two things.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: One, that we were helping those at genuine risk of persecution, or British nationals, or people who had worked for the British government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: And secondly, making sure that we didn't allow anyone to come into the UK who might present a threat to the UK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Prime Minister Boris Johnson has rejected the criticism of how the withdrawal from Afghanistan was organised.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: No, that's complete nonsense, but what I can tell you is that I think that the operation of pitting to airlift 15,000 people out of Kabul in the way that we did over the summer was one of the outstanding military achievements of the last 50 years or more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Since the August operation ended the British government says it's also helped more than 3,000 people leave Afghanistan and is still working to help to get others out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Olaf Scholz will be sworn in later as Germany's new Chancellor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: He's already been elected by the Bundestag this morning in a secret ballot.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Parliament also waved goodbye to Angela Merkel, who's held the post for 16 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Scholz's new coalition government comes with a new line-up of faces and a new set of policies. Our reporter Kate Brady has more from Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: A coalition deal between Germany's Social Democrats, Greens and Free Democrats was signed

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: and sealed on Tuesday, paving the way for the new government to be sworn in. Under the motto, dare more progress, designated Chancellor Olaf Scholz said that it should be a morning for a new start and it certainly is the start of something new. The three parties in the so-called traffic light coalition are somewhat unlikely bedfellows and the coming four years are certainly going to be a tricky balancing act particularly when it comes to issues of spending and also climate protection measures. But first of all, the number one priority right now is of course the ever-pressing issue of the pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: So all that's left to do now is for the Bundestag, Germany's lower house of parliament, to elect Scholz as chancellor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: And that's taking place in a secret ballot.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: For a majority, 369 of parliament's 736 MPs will have to vote in favour of Scholz.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: And after his election, which looks very likely given that the coalition itself holds 416 seats, it's off to Schloss Bellevue, where Scholz will be welcomed by President Frank-Walter Steinmeier for his certificate of appointment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Then it's the Cabinet's turn to be sworn in.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: And after all of that, Scholz will make one last stop to the chancellery.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: And it's there that outgoing Chancellor Angela Merkel will hand over official duties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: And with that comes the end of an era after her 16 years in office.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Then the real work can begin for the new government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: And it's certainly not going to be an easy start.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Kate Brady, Euronews, Berlin. The WHO has advised governments to only use mandatory vaccinations as a last-ditch measure

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: in fighting the ongoing pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It comes as Germany announced plans to make the jab mandatory for healthcare workers, along with Austria requiring all citizens to be fully vaccinated by February 1st.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: WHO Europe Director Hans Kluge says mandating the vaccine could backfire, with people losing faith in public institutions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Mandates around vaccination are an absolute last resort and only applicable when all other feasible options to improve vaccination uptake have been exhausted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The effect that mandating vaccination could have on public confidence and public trust, as well as vaccination uptake must be considered.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: The WHO also recommended vaccinating school children in order to stop infections and protect the young against contracting long Covid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Vaccinating children should be discussed and considered nationally as part of school protection measure. discussed and considered nationally as part of school protection measures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Vaccination of younger children not only reduces their role in COVID-19 transmission, but also protects them from pediatric severity, whether associated with long COVID or multi-system inflammatory syndromes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: The Omicron variant of COVID-19 is starting to take its grip across Europe. system, inflammatory syndromes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Protesters in Brussels tried to storm the health minister's office on Tuesday during a demonstration organized by health care workers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: A small group marched towards the building, setting off flares and banging on the glass entrance before being dispersed by the police.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Belgium has made vaccinations mandatory for all its health workers starting January 1st with a three-month window to get their shots or risk being dismissed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We are already short of personnel and if we stop unvaccinated health workers there will be fewer beds and therefore more patients who will not be treated. And so we have to stop this division and see the real problem. The problem is the lack of beds and the lack of value given to the profession.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: We're in favour of vaccination, but why only health workers? Because everyone must get vaccinated. It's either everyone or no one. As I told you earlier, in 2020 we were applauded, in 2021 no recognition and in 2022 people will be fired. So I tell you, it's really a question of recognition." Poland has announced compulsory Covid vaccinations for doctors, teachers and security service personnel from the first of March. The government ordered a series of measures designed to curb the spread of the virus, such as closing nightclubs, reducing access to restaurants and cinemas and enforcing the health pass.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Joining several other EU nations, Spain's health commission has approved Covid-19 vaccinations for children under 12.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Spanish authorities expect to start vaccinating children from December 13th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The decision comes amid an acceleration of Covid cases and a recommendation by the EU's health regulator.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, EU health agencies have recommended that COVID vaccines be mixed and matched for both initial and booster doses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: While the EMA and ECDC say that more research is required following the initial positive evidence, many countries such as the US have already deployed the mix-and-match strategy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Thank you so much. Thank you.

sentences.sentence: At least two people have been killed and up to five more have been injured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's not clear if there are some more people trapped beneath the rubble of the three-storey residential block.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A suspected gas leak is thought to be the cause.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Strong winds, heavy rain and snow have hit much of Ireland and parts of Scotland as Storm Barra sweeps across the region. The wintry weather is threatening further disruption to areas only just recovering from lengthy power cuts in the wake of storm Arwen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Around 56,000 homes and businesses have been left without power after winds gusting up to 130 km per hour moved eastwards.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The rush up to Christmas is not a good time to have a technical hitch.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Amazon and some other services, including Prime Video and Alexa, have been hit by computer problems.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Amazon's cloud computing arm, which provides services to governments, companies and universities, is also affected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The giant tech firm says that things are on the mend, but they're not yet completely resolved. This Wednesday, the Festival of Lights kicks off in Lyon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: During four days, the entire city lights up at night as public buildings, town squares, parks and even lakes become canvases for works of art.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's a child's instinct.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We like to throw pebbles on the water.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's always intriguing that the pebbles' impact creates light waves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: There's a dialogue between the vegetal canopy and the water surface.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This year, the organizers want the festival to be more inclusive for all generations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: All in all 27 places in Lyon form part of the backdrop for 31 sound and light performances.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This year we put the focus on young creators. 60% of the artists who present their artwork at the Fête des Lumières are new participants. Jeremy Bello was supposed to take part in it last year for the first time, but then came Covid and the vast majority of the Fête des Lumières programme was cancelled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We benefited from this time to think and ask ourselves about our relation to society, about our take on reality and to offer an artwork which has evolved during these past two years and which is presented now in its best version.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This year, the Fête de Lumière takes place despite the ongoing pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: However, visitors must wear face masks and need a sanitary pass to visit indoor installations.
